metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1717 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.116, does not properlyuse numeric casts during handling of typed arrays, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1717` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
